meanings.definition: The space between the curve of an arch and a rectangular enclosure.
meanings.sent1: The spandrils of the arch were beautifully decorated with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: Architects often pay attention to the design of the spandrils to enhance the overall look of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to hide its acorns in the spandrils of the old bridge.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts echoed in her mind, bouncing off the spandrils of memories.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the spandrils, casting a warm glow in the room.

meanings.definition: The triangular space between the outer curve of an arch and the rectangular frame surrounding it.
meanings.sent1: Visitors admired the intricate carvings on the spandrils of the ancient archway.
meanings.sent2: The spandrils of the arch provided structural support while adding aesthetic appeal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to climb up the spandrils of the garden trellis.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, bouncing off the spandrils like joyful echoes.
meanings.sent5: The shadows danced along the spandrils, creating a mesmerizing play of light and dark.
